content.description: Start:  30 right of Narrow Notch below two obvious cracks in an overhanging wall.   Climb over a bulge to a ledge.  From the ledge, climb the cracks up the overhanging wall.
content.location: 30 right of Narrow Notch below two obvious cracks in an overhanging wall.

content.description: Start: Approximately 70 feet downstream from the Black Bulge and just upstream from the Great Falls Bulge is a small vertical wall facing the river.   Ascend left slanting cracks to a right slanting crack. Move right and up to top.
content.location: Approximately 70 feet downstream from the Black Bulge and just upstream from the Great Falls Bulge

content.description: Start: On the upstream end of a large cliff containing numerous bulges is a left facing corner leading up to a sloping ledge.   Climb corner to sloping ledge. Traverse right to a small left facing corner. Climb corner and easy route to the top.   Note:  This was a standard lead in the 40's and 50's.
content.protection: Generally Top-Roped these days. Trees on top serve as anchor.
content.location: On the upstream end of a large cliff containing numerous bulges is a left facing corner leading up to a sloping ledge.

content.description: Start same as the Black Bulge.   Climb up the Black Bulge, approximately 5 feet, until it is possible to traverse left into the orange groove. Follow the groove to the top.
content.location: Start same as the Black Bulge

content.description: After the initial bulge climb the left facing corner to the right of the cracks.
Start in the middle of the cliff, 30 feet left of the Great Falls Bulge at two cracks that go diagonally upwards to the right.   Surmount the bulge and climb the diagonal cracks.
content.location: 30 feet left of the Great Falls Bulge

content.description: Scramble down the cliff approximately 100 feet upstream from the Little Bulge
content.location: Approximately 100 feet upstream from the Little Bulge.

content.description: Start 5 feet right of the First Lead Corner.   Move up right and climb the face.
content.location: 5 feet right of the First Lead Corner

climbs.name: Great Falls Bulge - Var: Super Bulge

content.description: See also Great Falls Bulge   From the ledge (see Great Falls Bulge) climb up the smooth bulge at small left facing corner. Pull the next "overlap" at its center and climb the face to the top
content.location: Just to the right and downstream from Peg's Progress start is a small bulging wall with a small left facing corner.

climbs.name: Great Falls Bulge - Var: Right Hand Start

content.description: See also Great Falls Bulge   Climb the bulge on its right hand side.
content.location: Just to the right and downstream from Peg's Progress start is a small bulging wall with a small left facing corner.

content.description: Start: Just to the right and downstream from Peg's Progress start is a small bulging wall with a small left facing corner.   Surmount the bulge following the corner. Climb the next bulge to join Peg's Progress at the ledge.
content.location: Just to the right and downstream from Peg's Progress start is a small bulging wall with a small left facing corner.

content.description: Start at the right edge of the face 20 feet right of First Lead Corner.   Pull through the overhang and climb up the right side of the face.
content.location: The right edge of the face 20 feet right of First Lead Corner.

content.description: Start at the base of a large inside corner facing upstream - follow the corner to the top
content.location: The base of a large inside corner facing upstream

content.description: Start five feet left of Peg's Progress. Climb broken crack to leftslanting ledge. Move up left along ledge then back right onto upper face. Then angle left to pull the overhang on its left side.
content.location: Between Pegs Progress and Short Line in the Bulges area

content.description: It is possible to descend the downstream side of Little Bulge by a series of sloping ledges.
content.location: The downstream side of Little Bulge.

content.description: Moving downstream, around the corner, from the First Lead Corner is a smooth bulging wall broken by one area of fractured rock.   Climb the bulge by following the broken rock.
content.location: Moving downstream, around the corner, from the First Lead Corner is a smooth bulging wall broken by one area of fractured rock

content.description: Start about 3-4 feet right of Narrow Notch.  Climb unto the big ledge then up the ribbed face on the right of the face.
content.location: About 20-25 feet left of Wild Thing and about 3-4 right of Narrow Notch in 'The Buldges' area.

content.description: Small bulge along the river standing 60 feet.  Two areas here - Little Bulge and Great Falls Bulge.  Easily seen from the Great Falls Virginia Side, but rarely will you see climbers on it.  The classic here is Super Bulge 5.11c/d.
